reviews.review_msg: Easily one of the best profs I've had. Super great prof and even better person, really fun and caring. Heavy reading load and class is discussion based so make sure to be caught up on your readings. Super fair grader!

Lectures were hard to follow, hard to pinpoint the most important things. Enjoyed his enthusiasm, good with letting everyone speak if desired. Reading pace is fast (too fast IMO) but I loved the book selection. Easy grader from my experience, straightforward midterm (final tbd). He wouldn't be my first choice but I would still take his class again!
Take his class. Love the guy.

Jon is one of the best professors I've had at SFU. His lectures shouldn't be missed, as the amount of supplementary content he provides on the novels can change the way you read them. Very understanding if one or two classes need to be missed, and his use of student-provided discussion questions allows for plenty of peer-discussion.

Jon is a stand-up prof. He has so many big ideas that sparked great class discussions. He can be a bit abrupt at times but never in a mean way, he's actually really funny. I felt like a lot of my classmates were too smart for me but Jon validated and listened to every one of my ideas and suggestions. One of the best in the English department.
